entries.meaning: A movement or position in which a person is upside down, supported by their arms with their hands on the ground.

verbs.description: handstand (third-person singular simple present handstands, present participle handstanding, simple past and past participle handstood)

examples: My student Jon for example is a juggler, wanting to add another string to his circus bow, he decided to learn to handstand; not wanting to ruin his wrists, he sought out some professional help in learning to handstand.
